text: The 1998 European 10,000m Cup was the 2nd edition of the European 10,000m Cup (the original name in 1998 was European 10,000m Challenge) and took place on 5 April in Lisbon, Portugal. ==Individual== ===Men=== {| class="wikitable" width=80% style="font-size:100%; text-align:left;" |- ! width = 60 | Rank ! width = 200 | Athlete ! width = 170 | Country ! width = 80 | Time |- | align=center| | Fabián Roncero || | align=center|27:14.44 |- | align=center| | António Pinto || | align=center|27:15.76 |- | align=center| | Dieter Baumann || | align=center|27:32.31 |} ===Women=== {| class="wikitable" width=80% style="font-size:100%; text-align:left;" |- ! width = 60 | Rank ! width = 200 | Athlete ! width = 170 | Country ! width = 80 | Time |- | align=center| | Fernanda Ribeiro || | align=center|30:48.06 |- | align=center| | Paula Radcliffe || | align=center|30:48.58 |- | align=center| | Marina Bastos || | align=center|32:20.51 |} ==Team== In italic the participants whose result did not go into the team's total time, but awarded with medals. ===Men=== {| class="wikitable" width=80% style="font-size:100%; text-align:center;" |- ! width = 60 | Rank ! width = 170 | Country ! width = 80 | Time |- bgcolor=f7f6a8 | | align=left| | 1:22:46.26 |- bgcolor=dce5e5 | | align=left| | 1:22:48.95 |- bgcolor=ffdab9 | | align=left| | 1:23:48.95 |} ===Women=== {| class="wikitable" width=80% style="font-size:100%; text-align:center;" |- ! width = 60 | Rank ! width = 170 | Country ! width = 80 | Time |- bgcolor=f7f6a8 | | align=left| | 1:35:29.45 |- bgcolor=dce5e5 | | align=left| | 1:36:57.33 |- bgcolor=ffdab9 | | align=left| | 1:38:08.22 |} ==References== ==External links== * EAA web site Category:European 10,000m Cup European Cup 10,000m
title: 1998 European 10,000m Challenge
